title: Bookmarks
subheading: Find a list of useful websites, great blogs, interesting ideas, and podcasts.

title: HTML & CSS is hard
subtitle: But it doesnâ€™t have to be. Explore this friendly web development tutorial for complete beginners.

title: A Complete Guide to Flexbox
subtitle: Comprehensive guide to CSS flexbox. This complete guide explains everything about flexbox, focusing on all the different possible properties for the parent element and the child elements.

title: A Complete Guide to Grid
subtitle: Comprehensive guide to CSS grid, focusing on all the settings both for the grid parent container and the grid child elements.

title: MDN Web Docs
subtitle: MDN Web Docs, previously Mozilla Developer Network and formerly Mozilla Developer Center, is a documentation repository and learning resource for web developers used by Mozilla, Microsoft, Google, and Samsung.

title: Web.dev
subtitle: Explore structured learning paths to discover everything you need to know about building for the modern web.

title: CSS for JS developers
subtitle: A comprehensive interactive course designed to change your relationship with CSS. We'll learn how the language really works, and empower you to build robust user interfaces.

title: Frontend Mentor
subtitle: Improve your front-end coding skills by building real projects. Solve real-world HTML, CSS and JavaScript challenges whilst working to professional designs. Join over 308.000+ developers building projects, reviewing code, and helping each other get better.

title: devChallenges
subtitle: The best way to learn is by doing. Choose a challenge, Work by yourself or with a team, Submit your solutions and give feedback

title: Designing Fluid Interfaces
subtitle: Discover the techniques used to create the fluid gestural interface of iPhone X. Learn how to design with gestures and motion that feel intuitive and natural, making your app a delight to use.

title: Design for spatial interaction
subtitle: Discover the principles for creating intuitive physical interactions between two or more devices, as demonstrated by Apple designers who worked on features for iPhone, HomePod mini, and Airtag. Explore how you can apply these patterns to your own app when designing features for Apple platforms, and help people using your app interact more directly with their surroundings.

title: Parks of Croatia - visual identity
subtitle: A short documentary on the topic of graphic design for nature and national parks in Croatia.

title: Introduction to Git
subtitle: This article goes over all the important stuff you need to know to get started using Git. You can read about the commands like git add, git commit, git branch, git checkout, and git merge!

title: Introduction to GitHub
subtitle: This article explains what is Github and how to get Started with it. GitHub is a hosting platform for Git repositories. You can use Git on its own without Github (and other similar platforms), but it's difficult to collaborate or share your code with others.

title: How to Write a Git Commit Message
subtitle: If you browse the log of any random Git repository, you will probably find its commit messages are more or less a mess. Commit messages matter. Here's how to write them well.

title: racOS
subtitle: A web3 enabled portal for all $RAC holders.

subtitle: Design is everywhere in our lives, perhaps most importantly in the places where we've just stopped noticing. 99% Invisible is a weekly exploration of the process and power of design and architecture. This podcast is hosted by Roman mars

title: Colt Steele
subtitle: Colt Steele is a Developer and Bootcamp Instructor, who spent years figuring out the 'formula' to teaching technical skills in a classroom environment, I can confidently say that his online courses are without a doubt the most comprehensive ones on the market.

title: CSS clip-path maker
subtitle: The clip-path property allows you to make complex shapes in CSS by clipping an element to a basic shape (circle, ellipse, polygon, or inset), or to an SVG source.

title: Kevin Powell
